thread.title: McMenamins entertainment complex opens as crown jewel of...
thread.title_full: McMenamins entertainment complex opens as crown jewel of... | www.kirotv.com

author: kirotv.com
title: McMenamins entertainment complex opens as crown jewel of...
text:
Bothell's newest development opened Thursday morning, adding to the city's revitalization.
The new McMenamins at the Anderson School is being called the crown jewel of the city's redevelopment.
McMenamins redeveloped the five-acre property which now includes a hotel, several bars, a movie theater, brewery and a pool.
The complex used to be an old junior high school.
The Anderson School is just one piece of a huge revitalization plan for Bothell which has had an 18 percent increase in population since 2000.
In two weeks, a new city hall will be opening with 254 underground parking spots.
In the last few years, the city has also widened roads and added 1,200 new homes and thousands of new jobs.
"We measure our success in terms of the dollars that we've spent. We've attracted over $300 million in private capital in just a few short years of the city's actions,‚Äù said Bothell City Manager Bob Stowe.
The Anderson School will be McMenamins largest project built at one time. The company has a similar entertainment complex in Oregon.
Anderson School is open Thursday starting at 7 a.m. with all day events.
The complex also has a saltwater pool. Bothell residents will be able to use it, free of charge.
